message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.PL

The paper proposes a new technique for learning hybrid automata automatically by observing the runtime behavior of a dynamical system. This involves the use of information-theoretic measures as a cost function for data segmentation and model selection to penalize over-fitting and to determine the likely causes of each transition. These techniques are commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The paper also deals with the recovery of causal hybrid automata, which involves the analysis of dynamic systems, making it relevant to the cs.SY sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of different classes of model templates and predicates, which are related to software engineering (cs.SE) and programming languages (cs.PL).
